intro: Sutera decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive sutera, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Sutera decipiens is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in coastal areas with ample sunlight.
